Description: Fragments of a core-formed glass alabastron or flask of Mediterranean Group 3; core-formed fusiform body, with trailed and marvered feathered decoration; translucent dark blue body and lug-handles; opaque white trails; rim, neck above lugs, one lug-handle and parts of the lower body are missing; surface covered by thick greyish-white weathering, flaked in parts leaving iridescence with pitting.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: The same tomb also produced a fragment of a Mycenaean core-formed glass vessel (1896,2-1,116; GR Glass Catalogue 20). As this is not known to have been a cemetery with tombs of this period, it is unlikely to be evidence for reuse (as suggested in the Catalogue, p. 127) but might be intrusive.
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (337)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 82, Tomb 26 no. 5; pg. 69 & fig. 98.)
